form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Rounds (for himself and Ms. Cortez Masto) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to modify the notification requirement for emergency contract health services for certain beneficiaries, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Indian Health Service Emergency Claims Parity Act.

section.header: Authorization for emergency contract health services
section.text: Section 406 of the Indian Health Care Improvement Act (25 U.S.C. 1646) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking With respect to and inserting the following:
by inserting before subsection (b) (as so designated) the following:

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), with respect to an Indian receiving emergency medical care or services from a non-Service provider or in a non-Service facility under the authority of this Act, the time limitation (as a condition of payment) for notifying the Service of such treatment or admission shall be 15 days.
